sentences.en: "Wait there!" Kathryn rose. "No, on second thought, follow me."
sentences.cn: “在那儿等着！”凯瑟琳站起身来，“不，我改主意了。跟我来。”

sentences.en: As I sidestepped, the bottle hit me on the left hip.
sentences.cn: 我侧一步要躲闪的时候，瓶子打中了我的左髋部。

sentences.en: Don't expect me to come and visit you there.
sentences.cn: 别指望我会去那儿看你。

sentences.en: English has hurt me a thousand times, but I still regard it as my first love.
sentences.cn: 英语伤我千百遍，我待英语如初恋。

sentences.en: Give that book to me.
sentences.cn: 把那本书给我。

sentences.en: He bought me a drink.
sentences.cn: 他给我买了一杯酒。

sentences.en: He came to me with a very long face.
sentences.cn: 他拉长了脸来找我。

sentences.en: Her burst of exuberance and her brightness overwhelmed me.
sentences.cn: 她勃发的热情和阳光的性格征服了我。

sentences.en: I feel it's done me good to get it off my chest.
sentences.cn: 我感觉吐吐苦水对我有好处。

sentences.en: I know you will join me in wishing them Godspeed.
sentences.cn: 我知道你会同我一起祝愿他们诸事顺遂的。

sentences.en: She'll crucify me if she finds you still here.
sentences.cn: 如果她发现你还在这儿，她会狠狠地教训我。

sentences.en: She’s two years older than me.
sentences.cn: 她比我大两岁。

sentences.en: Stop, you’re hurting me.
sentences.cn: 住手，你弄疼我了。

sentences.en: That’s me, standing on the left.
sentences.cn: 那是我，站在左边的那一个。

sentences.en: The company treated me as though I were skiving.
sentences.cn: 公司对待我的态度就好像是我上班时溜号了似的。

sentences.en: The police told me. It was a bombshell. I had no idea.
sentences.cn: 是警察告诉我的。我很震惊，完全没想到。

sentences.en: Then something seemed to snap in me. I couldn't endure any more.
sentences.cn: 这时候，我的心里像有个东西突然绷断了——我再也忍受不了啦。

sentences.en: Today was really a bit of a write-off for me.
sentences.cn: 今天对我来说真的有点儿白白浪费了。

sentences.en: We'll manage somehow, you and me. I know we will.
sentences.cn: 我和你，我们总能应付过去的。我知道我们会的。

sentences.en: Well, at any rate, let me thank you for all you did.
sentences.cn: 好吧，不管怎样，还是要感谢你所做的一切。

words.tran_cn: 自我；极端自私的人；自我的一部分

trans.tran_cn: 自我，自我的一部分，极端自私的人，[音乐]固定唱法时的E音
trans.tran_en: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself
used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself
